intro: Your task is to conduct a pressure area check on Mr Burton, a wheelchair user. Ensure he understands and practices proper pressure relief techniques, has appropriate cushioning, correct posture, and that his footwear and positioning are safe.
description_html:
This scenario focuses on pressure area care for a wheelchair user. You will practice checking equipment, posture, and teaching pressure relief techniques to prevent skin breakdown.

Learning objectives:

  • Assess wheelchair cushions and positioning
  • Teach pressure relief exercises
  • Check footwear and footrests for safety
  • Encourage proper posture in wheelchair
  • Understand why certain cushions are unsafe

resident.name: Mr Burton
goals: demonstrate awareness of leaning forward to relieve pressure
mention cushion change (rubber ring replaced with gel)
accept explanation about why gel cushion is safer
confirm ability to lean side to side
allow check of knees, footrests, shoes, and socks
seek reassurance about footwear and socks
must_disclose: leans forward hourly to relieve pressure
uses gel cushion (daughter previously bought rubber ring)
does arm push-ups to lift bottom
leans side to side in chair
asks if shoes and socks are OK
refusals: does not want to use rubber ring cushion
cannot fully reposition without some support

safety.if_red_flag_then: advise correct cushion use; smooth socks; adjust footrests; escalate to nurse if redness, pain, or skin breakdown is noted

actions.title: Check wheelchair cushion
actions.prompt: You inspect Mr Burton's gel cushion to ensure it's properly positioned and providing adequate pressure relief.

actions.title: Adjust footrests
actions.prompt: You check and adjust the height of the footrests to ensure Mr Burton's knees are at the correct angle.

actions.title: Check shoes and socks
actions.prompt: You examine Mr Burton's shoes to ensure they fit properly and check that his socks are smooth without wrinkles.

actions.title: Demonstrate pressure relief
actions.prompt: You demonstrate and encourage Mr Burton to do a pressure relief exercise by leaning forward or doing an arm push-up.

actions.title: Check posture
actions.prompt: You check Mr Burton's sitting posture and gently encourage him to sit upright to reduce pressure on his lower back.

actions.title: Inspect pressure points
actions.prompt: You carefully check Mr Burton's bottom, lower back, and heels for any signs of redness or pressure damage.
